Git Crash Course

A Quick Tour Through Git

by Scott Chacon

Me

Scott Anthony Chacon

http://git-scm.com

http://gitref.org

http://progit.org

@chacon

schacon@gmail.com

</me>

Getting Git

how do you get a git repository?

git clone

but even simpler...

who has used RCS?

git init

Snapshotting

creating your snapshots

1. staging your content

git add

2. seeing what is staged

git status

git diff

3. recording the staged content

git commit

even simpler way

git commit -a

Branching

contexts to isolate your work in

1. create a new context

git branch

2. switch to another context

git checkout

1,2. create and switch at the same time

git checkout -b

Merging

combine two or more contexts

git merge

Sharing

telling Git about another repository

git remote

updating a branch in another repository with one of yours

git push

getting all the branches in another repository

git fetch

Overview

12 Commands

  • git init
  • git clone
  • git add
  • git status
  • git diff
  • git commit
  • git branch
  • git checkout
  • git merge
  • git remote
  • git push
  • git fetch

that's it!
